Authors: Sfenrianto S., Junadi J., Saragih M.H.
Title: The analysis of consumer's intention model for using E-payment system in Indonesia
Source title: Proceedings - 2017 International Conference on Sustainable Information Engineering and Technology, SIET 2017
Affiliations: Information Systems Management Department, BINUS Graduate Program - Master of Information Systems Management, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Management Department, BINUS Business School Undergraduate Program, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Sfenrianto, S., Information Systems Management Department, BINUS Graduate Program - Master of Information Systems Management, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Junadi, J., Information Systems Management Department, BINUS Graduate Program - Master of Information Systems Management, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Saragih, M.H., Management Department, BINUS Business School Undergraduate Program, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: The objective of this research is to identify the factors that encourage consumers' intention to use the electronic payment system for e-commerce transaction in Indonesia. This study was developed based on a model of factors influencing consumer's intention to use e-payment, namely culture, perceived security, performance expectancy, effort expectancy and social influence. In conducting this study, the data is obtained from 110 respondents who used electronic transactions using e-payment. Meanwhile, the data collected was analyzed using Structural Equation Modeling (SEM). From the analysis, it is known that all these factors significantly influence the value of the use of e-payment. The sequence is based on a significant level of the greatest to the smallest are effort expectancy (0.346), culture (0.337), social influence (0.330), performance expectancy (0.272) and perceived security (0.166). © 2017 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Customer's Intention; E-Business; E-Commerce; E-Payment; Model
Index Keywords: Economic and social effects; Electronic commerce; Models; Customer's Intention; E-commerce transactions; E-payments; eBusiness; Electronic payment systems; Electronic transaction; Perceived securities; Structural equation modeling; Electronic money
